1457767790849449985.text: The promise of opportunity and freedom for America’s children must be an urgent societal and governmental priority. My Five Freedoms for America's Children makes long overdue investments in our kids—and thus our future. https://t.co/ev6utM5XU8

1457767789754785797.text: Freedom to be Safe from Harm: Invest an additional $750 million in local- and state-based child abuse prevention and prosecution.

1457767788420997122.text: Freedom from Hunger: Enhance automatic certification of more children for school meal programs and increase retroactive reimbursement of school meals for eligible children not initially covered.

1457767787305357321.text: Freedom to Learn: Invest an additional $25 billion in child care and early learning programs like Head Start to cover all eligible 3–5 year old children, and a permanent expansion of the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit to help working families cover the cost of child care.

1457767786126659584.text: Freedom to be Economically Secure: Permanent expansion of the #ChildTaxCredit and the creation of children's savings accounts, seeded annually with $500 in federal contributions, for kids in families earning under $100,000.

1457767784990060553.text: Freedom to be Healthy: Every child would be automatically enrolled in Medicaid from birth through age 18 (parents would have the option to opt out for private insurance).

1433157603865939968.text: As this work continues, Congress must ensure states and emergency food providers have the funding and resources required to respond to the severity of the ongoing food insecurity crisis.

1433157602821562368.text: I introduced the Farm to Food Bank Act in 2018, which was modeled after Pennsylvania’s PASS program. The bill established food recovery networks in every state and was incorporated into the 2018 Farm Bill.

1431334905540227072.text: We pray for the servicemembers who lost their lives, their families and ourselves that we may be worthy of their valor.

1374427985743204352.text: For states that have not expanded their Medicaid program under the ACA, the ARP provides an incentive by increasing federal support for 2 years if they expand Medicaid. This means more families will have quality, affordable coverage through Medicaid.

1374427984023617539.text: This investment will provide a larger subsidy for those who are already eligible & expand the subsidy to more middle class families that did not previously qualify for help w/ their premiums. This means more people will be able to afford comprehensive coverage through an ACA plan

1374427982274564103.text: We fought to include important first steps in the American Recovery Plan. Over the next 2 years, the ARP will invest roughly $35 billion in the ACA’s monthly assistance for health insurance premiums.

1374427980529692672.text: And, every Republican politician in Congress voted against reducing health care costs for middle class families through the ACA.

1374427978629718018.text: Reminder: all the right wing politicians who told you 11 years ago that passing the ACA would result in all manner of catastrophes were wrong. They were wrong then and they’re wrong now about policies that help lift up hardworking people.

1374427977442717701.text: The Affordable Care Act is 11 years old today! It put in place consumer protections for all, helped hardworking families get health insurance and expanded Medicaid. It works and now we need to build on it.

1374408435723169797.text: We must also debate and vote on bills like the one that @RepDwightEvans and I lead, the Resources for Victims of Gun Violence Act, to ensure that we are supporting the survivors left in the wake of gun violence.

1374408434573930499.text: We must debate and vote on common sense bills that the majority of Americans support, like universal background checks, to finally address and prevent this senseless violence.

1374408433110151178.text: I applaud @SenatorDurbin and @JudiciaryDems for holding a tragically timely and necessary hearing this morning on common sense gun violence prevention. #EndGunViolence

1374408431457636354.text: In the midst of soaring gun violence across our Nation, including in Philadelphia, and in the aftermath of the tragedies in Atlanta and Boulder, I am proud that Democrats are finally able to take the lead to ensure that we finally confront the gun violence crisis in our Nation.

1374408430048346120.text: This uniquely American problem of gun violence has ravaged our streets, parks, churches and businesses for far too long. Unfortunately, my Republican colleagues have refused to even let us debate, let alone vote, on common sense gun violence prevention measures.

1374408428538327045.text: My heart also breaks for the families who have to live with the pain of this public health crisis of gun violence every day. In Philadelphia, after a record breaking year of gun violence in 2020, the city has already seen a 28% increase in homicides from the same time last year.

1361787227513253898.text: Justan, along with his partner Kevin, founded Change Now, a local non-profit organization serving the greater Lehigh Valley that focuses on caring for the unsheltered population and serving families in need.

1361787226321993728.text: He has partnered with the City of Allentown to review their Use of Force policy, spoken at colleges across the Lehigh Valley about his activism and provided testimony for the Democratic Policy Committee in Harrisburg.

1361787225038553088.text: From there, he organized & participated in additional Black Lives Matter marches, and formed a collective with local community & nonprofit leaders, so they could brainstorm new initiatives for racial justice, equity and equality for Black and Brown residents in the Lehigh Valley.

1361787223763468290.text: What started out as an idea to gather a few of his friends downtown to march for the deaths of George Floyd and Breonna Taylor, turned into hundreds attending including the mayor, chief of police and members of local government.

1361787222496845827.text: Justan founded Black Lives Matter Lehigh Valley this past summer after organizing the city’s first BLM march along with longtime friend Shaqwanna Griffin.

1361787221297266689.text: Justan was born in Scranton, and relocated with his family to Allentown at the age of five. He is a product of the Allentown School District and currently resides in the city with his partner, Kevin, and his two children, Shyllee and Shamaer.

1360754515373400067.text: My statement following the Senate trial of former President Trump: https://t.co/YFrPRa7Jsb

1360754028859318274.text: I voted to convict the former President in the most bipartisan presidential impeachment proceedings in our Nation’s history.

1360754027181584395.text: The former President attacked the foundational principles of our democracy and the peaceful transfer of power. He violated his oath of office and he committed a high crime against our Constitution.

1360754025751265280.text: He endangered the lives of countless Congressional staffers and employees, members of the press and members of Congress. He put a target on the back of his own Vice President and his Vice President’s family. And he has shown no remorse for any of it.

1360754024568520704.text: He did not merely endanger another branch of government and the presidential line of succession. His actions led to at least five deaths, injuries to nearly 140 members of law enforcement and untold collateral damage resulting from the carnage of that day.

1360754023155068929.text: “[I]f you don’t fight like hell, you’re not going to have a country anymore.” The former President led his supporters to a breaking point and as he had predicted in the past—it was “very bad, very bad.”

1360754021586374657.text: There's no way that a reasonable person could dispute that the former President knew exactly what he was doing by perpetuating the “Big Lie,” summoning his crowd of insurrectionists on January 6 and telling them:

1360754019828908032.text: It was about a President who once bragged: “I have the tough people [supporting me], but they don’t play it tough until they go to a certain point, and then it would be very bad, very bad.”

1360754017413042178.text: It was about a President who regularly condoned or encouraged violence at political rallies against protestors and members of the press.

1360754015949246465.text: This case was not merely about the former President’s speech on January 6. This was about a pattern of conduct. It was about the former President’s autocratic leadership and calls for political violence throughout his presidency.

1360754014594433032.text: And he directed them to the Capitol to prevent Congress from conducting its constitutional obligation to count the presidential electoral votes.

1360754012988071938.text: After repeatedly failing to overturn the election, the former President summoned his mob of insurrectionists to Washington, D.C. on January 6, 2021 for one more attack on American democracy. He invited them. He incited them.

1360754011662651394.text: After losing in federal and state courts, he then tried to pressure state and local elections officials to overturn the election, and even attempted to pressure his Vice President to violate the Vice President’s Constitutional duty.

1360754010110783495.text: This lie was roundly dismissed by more than 60 judges across the Nation—including in Pennsylvania.

1360754008944758785.text: For months after the election, we all witnessed the former President’s “Big Lie” when he repeatedly claimed—without any evidence—that the 2020 general election was stolen from him.

1360754007589990412.text:
My statement following the Senate trial of former President Trump:

This past week, the House Managers put forward a compelling case based upon irrefutable facts against the former President of the United States.

1360604016883957776.text: Impeachment is about protection, not punishment. https://t.co/0XHcJYucVO

1360601975042281472.text: As we enter the final stages of the trial, my thoughts on the defense’s argument, fight song, and the most chilling evidence I’ve seen: https://t.co/Yf06qKcl2x

1360042890223882241.text:
Day 3: One of the most important things that was said today came from Impeachment Manager @RepRaskin, which is that democracy is rare and fragile.

We've got to work to preserve it, and that's one of the reasons we're having this trial. We can't take our democracy for granted. https://t.co/risdtgl7J8

1339668907217530884.text: Clean Slate is an important step to ensuring that millions of Americans, and their families, aren’t unfairly burdened by minor criminal records and that these individuals have a second chance to fully participate in society. https://t.co/zCY3fqUoET

1339668906236112898.text: The Clean Slate Act of 2020 would provide much needed relief to millions of Americans by establishing an automatic sealing process for individuals who have successfully completed their sentences after being convicted of low-level federal drug offenses.

1339668905149788164.text: More than 1 in 3 adults have some form of a criminal record, keeping them from participating in many facets of everyday life as nearly nine in ten employers, four in five landlords and three in five colleges utilize background checks to screen applicants.

1339668904118005762.text: In 2018, @GovernorTomWolf signed the first automated criminal record-clearing law in the Nation after receiving tremendous bipartisan support in the Pennsylvania General Assembly. I am pleased to expand on Pennsylvania’s historic work with this legislation.

1339668903245606912.text: We must do more to help Americans with low-level, nonviolent criminal records get back on their feet after paying their debt to society.
